Text:
I wake to the singing of birds. It is the same time I
normally get up.
...Seems that it was an uneventful night.

If there had been any trouble, someone would've
come to wake me up.

But since that didn't happen, there clearly weren't
any issues that needed my attention...
Phew...

I wash my face and comb my hair, getting myself ready
for the day.

As the one overseeing the Garden in place of Shadow,
I can't afford to show any weakness.

I check myself over and, seeing that all is well,
I leave my room to get some breakfast.
That reminds me...

Something pops into my head as I pass by the Seven
Shadows' rooms.

(Eta was conducting an experiment last night.
I wonder what she's up to now?)

(Once Eta starts an experiment, she becomes completely
engrossed, so it's entirely possible that she's been awake
in the lab all this time.)

(She may also have decided to rest and still be fast
asleep.)

(Whichever it is, missing one meal isn't much of
an issue, but...)
...I think I'd better check.

I make my way over to Eta's lab and knock lightly
on the door.
...No response. She's either asleep or elsewhere.

If it's the former then I can't bear to wake her,
so I gently turn the doorknob.
Zzz... Zzz...

Looks like it's the former after all. Eta is facedown
on her desk, still in her work clothes.
Hehe...
(She must've been at it until late into the night.)

(As a token of respect for her tenacity, I'll let her
sleep for a little while longer.)
...My little hard worker.

I drape a nearby blanket over Eta, and quietly
leave the room.

(Now then, time for breakfast. I suppose Delta will
already be there.)

(That girl is very punctual when it comes to
meal times.)
Awoo! Food! Foooood! I'm hungry!

As expected, Delta is already seated. Armed with a
fork and spoon, she is tapping away at the rim of
her cup.

Good morning, Delta. That's bad manners, you
know.

Good morning, Lady Alpha! I really can't wait any
longer!
What're we eating today? Meat? Fish?

Let me see... I'm pretty sure it's eggs Benedict.
Or in simpler terms, bacon and eggs.

I recall the menu of what the cooks at Shadow
Garden are going to make today.

(In the past, when Shadow Garden was still but a small
organization, we all took turns preparing meals.)

(I did my fair share of work too, but I have to wonder
if I can still make a proper meal like I did back then.
I hope I haven't gotten too rusty...)
Bacon! I love bacon!
And then the garnish will be spinach and carrots, and...
Blech...

Delta flashes a face of disgust, showing all too
clearly how she feels.

How are you supposed grow bigger if you don't eat
your vegetables?

Ha-ruff... You always say stuff like that to get me
to eat veggies!

But that's a lie! I don't get any bigger, no matter
how many veggies I eat!

My, my. But you have gotten bigger, see? You simply
haven't noticed it yourself.
Huh? Really?!

Yes. And if you keep growing, who knows, you may
get even bigger than Shadow.
...No way.

(My, someone is unusually assertive today. Maybe it's
because she recognizes Shadow as her Boss?)
Why not?

Because sometimes, Boss eats the same things as me!
So Boss is going to get that much bigger, too!

Or so I thought, but her answer is much more
amusing.

Hehe. I wonder? Even if you are eating the same
things, the portions you eat are much larger.

Oh yeah, you're right! Boss never goes back for
seconds!

Right? That's why if you get seconds of vegetables,
you may overtake Shadow.

Wow... I gotta tough it out and eat lotsa veggies,
then...!
Hehe, good girl.

Without fail, Delta is like an unruly child.
She really is exceedingly cute.

But, that does also mean that she can be quite
a handful—
Ack?!

Sounds like something fell down... I wonder where
the sound came from.
I know! It came from the storeroom!
Trouble in the storeroom, huh...

(It seems our next-biggest troublemaker might have
gotten herself into some mischief...)

I'm going to take a look, so you wait here for the
others, okay?

Once the food arrives, there's no need to wait.
You can all go ahead and eat without me.
Okaaay!
